newsitem.title: ESTONIA: SOCCER-ESTONIA SAYS TO MEET SCOTLAND IN CYPRUS.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-ESTONIA SAYS TO MEET SCOTLAND IN CYPRUS.

text.p: The soccer association of Estonia on Tuesday said it had preliminary agreement from Scottish and Cypriot soccer officials to replay a World Cup qualifier with Scotland in Cyprus on February 11.

"I got acceptances by telephone this morning from the Cypriot Football Federation and also from the Scottish Football Association," Sulev Pohlak, a member of the board of the Estonian Football Association, said.
The original group four game on October 9 ended in farce when it was stopped after three seconds after the Estonian team failed to turn up for a rescheduled kick-off.

Soccer's ruling body FIFA originally awarded the game to Scotland with a 3-0 victory but later ruled that the Estonians were not given enough warning about the earlier time and said it should be replayed.
Estonia wanted to play the tie in Cyprus in February as its team would be training on the island at that time.
